creditline: Gift of Mrs. John Crosby, in memory of Mrs. Albert W. Hastings
description: argyle in form of a hot water jug with a double lining or jacket into which the hot water was poured down the lip that can be seen while the gravy was placed inside the body of the jug; cover separate; border of gadrooning around base (replacement handle)28.66*
medium: Sheffield plate (silver fused to copper), wood (replaced)
title: Argyle
